channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7809] Refactor Split/Merge to use HRegionFileSystem
item.description: Use the HRegionFileSystem for the fs operations.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: left minor general feedback, may review in more detail later... btw, you can attach combined patches to jira to run tests even before the prerequisites are ready
+1 in general; do you have jira to do the cleanup mentioned in /r/? Also tests should run.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12572126/HBASE-7809-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 36 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster

one more rebase, stuff went in changing the HRegion import (no changes from v1)
Skimmed the patch +1. I like the reorganization, removed fs methods, and shutdown of access. Should it go in 0.95? Would it make your life easier Matteo Bertozzi?
I'm ok for 95, since there're no logic changes at this point.
